newsitem.title: USA: Budgetel to spend $2.5 mln on renovations.
newsitem.headline: Budgetel to spend $2.5 mln on renovations.

text.p: Budgetel Inns Inc, a national chain of motels owned and franchised by Marcus Corp, said Tuesday it is investing more than $2.5 million to convert rooms into new business-class rooms.

The chain plans to convert 10 percent of all rooms at each of its locations into "BusinessFirst" rooms. They will include more than 20 business-travel amenities, including extra-large desks, ergonomic chairs and speakerphones, the company said.
The conversion program is underway and is expected to be completed by the end of March, 1997, the company said.
"Gone are the days when business travelers used their hotel-room bed as a workstation," said Kelli Trumble, a business travel consultant and spokeswoman for Budgetel.

Budgetel said it conducted extensive market research into the needs of business travelers, and the BusinessFirst rooms were tested at six Budgetel sites which confirmed the need for business rooms and amenities.
Marcus Corp includes four divisions -- motels, movie theatres, hotels/resorts and restaurants. The company operates and franchises 135 Budgetel Inns in 28 states.
